description:
This trail will walk you through how to write a Trail.

Maxwell Bates

pavers.intro:
This trail will walk you through the basic composition of a Trail. Trails are JSON files, with components which adhere to several different schemas:

Trails consist of TrailModules.

TrailModules contain either a set of Pavers or a TrailTransclude.

Pavers are the primary composing unit of a trail, and contain text, templates, videos, Quizs, etc.

So a Trail might look like this (focusing only on layout, not content or description fields):

  • Normal TrailModule
    • Simple Paver
    • Paver
      • Quiz
  • Transclusion TrailModule
    • TrailTransclude
Below is an example trail, in JSON format
The Trail Schema is the container for the entire trail.
TrailModules are essentially containers for TrailTranscludes and Pavers. They break up content into meaningful blocks.
TrailTranscludes are used to transclude the content of another Trail.
Pavers are the primary unit of content in Trails. They can contain several fields, enumerated below.
